intro: Landtia schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian daisy, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is well adapted to arid conditions. Landtia schimperi is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its bright, long-lasting blooms.
